greenmirror.fxwrappers

Class ImageFxWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • greenmirror.FxWrapper
        • greenmirror.fxwrappers.ImageFxWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class ImageFxWrapper
extends FxWrapper
    The FxWrapper for image FX nodes. The JavaFX type is ImageView and its image content type is Image.
    Author:
    Karim El Assal

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ImageFxWrapper.FitHeightTransition
      A Transition class that animates the change of the height.

      A Transition class that animates the change of the width.
      static class  ImageFxWrapper.ImageTransition 
      static class  ImageFxWrapper.XTransition
      A Transition class that animates the x value of an ImageView.
      static class  ImageFxWrapper.YTransition
      A Transition class that animates the y value of an ImageView.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class greenmirror.FxWrapper

        FxWrapper.FadeTransition, FxWrapper.RotateTransition

    • Method Detail

      • getAnimatableProperties

        protected @NonNull List<FxPropertyWrapper> getAnimatableProperties()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the JavaFX node's properties that can be animated (and thus: can be changed during a transition). All animatable properties also are changable properties. These differ per subclass, but always contain the ones defined by FxWrapper. Overriding subclasses should also execute this method.
        Overrides:
        getAnimatableProperties in class FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the properties that can be animated
        See Also:
        FxWrapper.getChangableProperties(), FxPropertyWrapper

      • getChangableProperties

        protected @NonNull List<FxPropertyWrapper> getChangableProperties()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the properties of the JavaFX node that can be changed using this FxWrapper. That they can be changed does not mean they can be animated. If a property is only changable, but not animatable, it can only be set once.
        Overrides:
        getChangableProperties in class FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the properties that can be changed by using this FxWrapper

      • getFxNode

        public ImageView getFxNode()
        Overrides:
        getFxNode in class FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the JavaFX node that this FxWrapper was created for

      • getX

        public Double getX()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the x coordinate of the virtual origin of the FX node. Warning: the origin might differ per subclass of FxWrapper (for example: circles have their origin in their center, while rectangles have their origin in their top left corner).

        This method is only added for compatibility reasons.

        Specified by:
        getX in class FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the x coordinate of the origin

      • getY

        public Double getY()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Returns the y coordinate of the virtual origin of the FX node. Warning: the origin might differ per subclass of FxWrapper (for example: circles have their origin in their center, while rectangles have their origin in their top left corner).

        This method is only added for compatibility reasons.

        Specified by:
        getY in class FxWrapper
        Returns:
        the y coordinate of the origin

      • setImage

        public @NonNull ImageFxWrapper setImage(Image value)
        Sets the virtual image property and notifies the observers.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value; should be an instance of StoredBytesImage
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is not an instance of StoredBytesImage

      • setImageFromFile

        public @NonNull ImageFxWrapper setImageFromFile(String filePath)
        Sets the image from a file path. This method first tries to find the file with ImageFxWrapper.class.getResourceAsStream(filePath) and if that does not work, it tries it again with new FileInputStream(filePath). If both won't work, an exception is thrown. The stored image is of type StoredBytesImage and the image's bytes are stored with it.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the image file
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file could not be found

      • setImageFromUrl

        public @NonNull ImageFxWrapper setImageFromUrl(@NonNull String url)
        Sets the image from an URL. This method uses new URL(url).openConnection() for the URL connection. The stored image is of type StoredBytesImage and the image's bytes are stored with it.
        Parameters:
        url - the url to the image file
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file could not be found
        NullPointerException - if inputStream is null

      • setPreserveRatio

        public @NonNull ImageFxWrapper setPreserveRatio(boolean value)
        Sets the virtual preserveRatio property and notifies the observers.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value
        Returns:
        this

      • clone

        public @NonNull ImageFxWrapper clone()
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Creates a shallow copy of this FxWrapper: only the property values are copied.
        Specified by:
        clone in class FxWrapper

      • determineSize

        private @NonNull double[] determineSize()
        Determines the size of the node for use with the calculations of placements. If the fitWidth is set, that value will be returned as the width. The height is determined on the basis of the value of isPreserveRatio(). If fitWidth is not set, it tries the same with fitHeight. If both aren't set, the width and height of the set image are returned.
        Returns:
        an array with the width on the first index and the height on the second

      • calculatePoint

        public @NonNull Point3D calculatePoint(@NonNull Placement placement)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Calculates the absolute point with of a specified Placement on the JavaFX node. E.g.: if this is a RectangleFxWrapper representing a 100x100 rectangle at position (10,10) of the canvas, calculatePoint(Placement.MIDDLE) would result in point (60,60).
        Specified by:
        calculatePoint in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        placement - the position of placement which should be calculated.
        Returns:
        the absolute point

        Creates the JavaFX node and makes it available via FxWrapper.getFxNode().
        Specified by:

      • animateToMiddlePoint

        public @NonNull Transition animateToMiddlePoint(@NonNull Point3D middlePoint,
                                                @NonNull Duration duration)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Creates the animation that changes the position of the JavaFX node to the point where its middle point is equal to middlePoint.
        Specified by:
        animateToMiddlePoint in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        middlePoint - the middle point of the FX node
        duration - the duration of the animation
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change

      • calculateOriginCoordinates

        protected @NonNull Point3D calculateOriginCoordinates(@NonNull Point3D middlePoint)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Calculates the coordinates of the FX node's origin when its middle point is equal to nodeMiddlePoint. These coordinates can differ per type of node.

        For example: rectangles have their origin coordinates in their upper left corner. This method would use the following calculation to calculate the x coordinate: double coordinateX = nodeMiddlePoint.getX() - getWidth() / 2; Similarly, an FxWrapper wrapping a circle node would return the same values as nodeMiddlePoint.

        Specified by:
        calculateOriginCoordinates in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        middlePoint - the middle point of the FX node
        Returns:
        the origin coordinates of the FX node

      • setToPositionWithMiddlePoint

        public void setToPositionWithMiddlePoint(@NonNull Point3D middlePoint)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Sets the virtual positioning property values to the point where its middle point is equal to nodesNewMiddlePoint.
        Specified by:
        setToPositionWithMiddlePoint in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        middlePoint - the new middle point indicating the positioning values of this wrapper

      • setFxToPositionWithMiddlePoint

        public void setFxToPositionWithMiddlePoint(@NonNull Point3D middlePoint)
        Description copied from class: FxWrapper
        Sets the JavaFX node positioning property values to the point where its middle point is equal to nodesNewMiddlePoint.
        Specified by:
        setFxToPositionWithMiddlePoint in class FxWrapper
        Parameters:
        middlePoint - the new middle point of the FX node
